snippet: China’s insatiable hunger for Latin America’s raw materials fueled the region’s most prosperous decade at least since the 1970s. That era is over.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column holds slowdown in China's economy has had devastating impact on Latin American countries that have become economically dependent on Chinese demand for their raw materials; warns era of Latin American prosperity that began in 1970s is now over and regional leaders must form new strategies toward long-term growth beyond simple sale of resources to other countries.
lead_paragraph: China’s insatiable hunger for Latin America’s raw materials fueled the region’s most prosperous decade at least since the 1970s. That era is over.

headline.main: Slowdown in China Bruises Economy in Latin America
headline.print_headline: Slowdown in China Bruises Economy in Latin America
